attributes.action: Open an inquiry into Atos/Maximus and the work capability assessment
attributes.background: There should be an independent inquiry into the work capability assessments carried out by ATOS and MAXIMUS. We need to know more about the terms of the contracts to know whether they are selling our data. We need to know how many people have died because of their actions.
attributes.additional_details: The “health care professionals” employed by these companies, who work directly for the DWP, should listen to the consultants. They say that seriously ill people are fit for work, and some have died within the space of a year. These contracted companies are paid £1.6 billion. These are foreign companies who get rich off the British taxpayer. There is no concern for Disabled persons in the UK.

attributes.action: Change the legislation regarding the trapping and killing of foxes and wildlife
attributes.background: Currently it is legal to trap foxes and other wildlife in snares and cages and then kill them "humanely." The very act of trapping and killing a wild animal is inhumane and is cruelty at it's best. The law should only allow farmers the right to kill an animal if said animal is causing problems.
attributes.additional_details: Hunters and generally nasty people are using these laws to trap foxes for training their dogs to hunt and kill. Hunting in this country is absolutely pointless and is purely to fulfill a sick ego. If we had bears and predatory animals roaming our streets then hunting would make more sense. The cruelty one can impose on an animal is merely a snapshot into their psyche and gives evidence they are not mentally healthy people who would not think much about inflicting pain on another human.

attributes.action: Apply to rejoin EFTA & retain EEA membership as objective of Art 50 negotiations
attributes.background: We call on HMG to aim for a practical workable realistic outcome in negotiations with the EU. To that end, rejoining EFTA & remaining in the EEA is the only sensible initial route. Any other approach will waste time, to the detriment of us all.

attributes.action: Make the police buy cars that are made in the UK and stop buying premium brands.
attributes.background: The UK has a large number of people employed in the automotive industry,  buying UK built cars helps secure UK jobs,  there is no need for the police to have  expensive BMW imported cars and Jaguar premium brand UK cars when a Vauxhall for example make a cheaper alternative that is made in the UK.

attributes.action: Regulate to ensure all rental properties are toxic mould and fungus free
attributes.background: Many of us are living in rented accommodation unfit for habitation. Toxic mould and fungus are lethal and nobody should be in that environment. I believe it is a breach of our human rights and breaks rules set out in our tenancy agreements, yet we are helpless and move from one place to the next.
attributes.additional_details: It sounds bizarre but nobody is regulating this. I'm not talking about a bit of condensation, I'm talking about when the building you live in is rotten. I'm talking about the landlords that paint over various toxic mould and damp problems to move a new tenant in so months later a jungle of danger grows back through, all the while a network of fungus roots start to form beneath the floor and then you have mushrooms sprouting. Tough regulation and penalties are needed to stop estate agents, landlords, freeholders, from making us ill.

attributes.action: Make the HPV vaccine programme aimed towards both sexes instead of only females.
attributes.background: The HPV vaccine (the 'jab' females are highly recommended to get before sexual activity) is not only necessary for females but males as well to help prevent anal, throat and penile cancers, as well as over 100 types of HPV diseases.
attributes.additional_details: Males are not encouraged to receive this vaccine before sexual activity based on the logic that if females don't have the HPV infections then males won't receive them through sexual contact. This leaves males who have sex with males vulnerable to the infections as well as ignoring the benefits the injection has to prevent multiple cancers. The NHS has been encouraging this change for years yet no action has been taken, leaving males uneducated in the matter and at risk of major health hazards.

attributes.action: Child Maintenance Service to calculate payments based on annual basic net pay.
attributes.background: Calculations shouldn't include overtime, shift allowances nor any bonuses.
attributes.additional_details: Receiving parents to provide evidence of what they spend child maintenance on

attributes.action: Make cyber bullying/online threats to be recognised as a serious crime.
attributes.background: There are too many people these days taking their own life due to online threats, bullying etc. If you have ever been to the police about online threats they generally will tell you they cannot help and this needs to stop. It needs to be investigated properly, this will lead to lives being saved.
attributes.additional_details:
Online bullying/threats have become a major problem as technology advances, so how many more people need to take their lives before anything changes?

Some facts in the UK about cyber bullying:
There were over 11,000 counselling sessions with young people who talked to Childline about online issues last year
More than 16,000 young people are absent from school due to bullying.
20% of people who experience cyber bullying contemplate suicide, 1 in 10 attempt it.

attributes.action: Free prescriptions for Students
attributes.background:
In a world where equal opportunity and equality are valued. I see it unfair that millions of students suffering from Mental Disabilities such as ADHD are required to pay for their prescriptions.

Students have limited funds and I feel that those funds should be spent on books, not their medication
attributes.additional_details:
Currently I myself have to pay for my medication, I pay £8.60 for my medication to help treat my ADHD. Paying for the tablets that put them on par with those not suffering from mental disabilities is something that millions of students are facing.
1 in 6 adults have a common mental disorder (CMD), and those of which who are students are occasionally, like myself, facing the choice; food or medication.
This is something I believe should be a thing of the past

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for companies to label their environmental impact on packaging
attributes.background: The same way we have warnings on packs of cigarettes, we need to inform consumers on the negative effects some of their purchase have on the planet. As a start, we request "Palm Oil Kills" warnings (text & picture) covering 13% of front & back of packaging for products using unsustainable palm oil.
attributes.additional_details: A large proportion of palm oil plantations are developed at the expense of biodiversity and ecosystems in the countries it is produced. Currently, a third of all mammal species in Indonesia are considered to be critically endangered as a consequence. Over 90% of orangutan habitat has been destroyed in the last 20 years and is considered “a conservation emergency” by the UN. An estimated 1000-5000 orangutans are killed each year for this development. More information can be found online.

attributes.action: More of the foreign aid budget should be funded towards WASH Projects globally.
attributes.background: Priti Patel, the Secretary of State for International Development said British aid money had previously been wasted and stolen. Funds as such could have been used towards Water And Sanitation Hygiene Projects; which would work towards the Global Goal 6, ensuring the availability of water to everyone
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government provide 0.7% of the Gross National Income to International aid. Most of this money is spent on educating children, immunisation, refugees and encouraging global action on climate change. However the water crisis is a significantly problematic issue, as 1 in 9 people do not have access to clean water and adequate sanitation, which kills 5,000 children daily.This leads to a lack of education and rapid spread of diseases, forcing families to fall further into extreme poverty.

attributes.action: Have a progressive capital gains tax in the U.K for high net worth individuals.
attributes.background: Only wealthy people make large gains on their assets; yet they pay the same as working people earning £11,000 to £43,000 per year; this is obviously unfair and perpetuates inequality. Let's create a fairer society where our taxes don't benefit the wealthy and everyone really pays their fair share.
attributes.additional_details:
The FTSE 100 average yearly gain is 5.4% (Motley Fool UK).  Yet average yearly earning income increases between 2001 and 2016 is just 2.3% (ONS). Clearly a CGT rate of 20% benefits the wealthy.
CGT shouldn't change for companies, only for high net worth individuals. Capital investment is essential to our economy; and individuals won't be put off investing if they have to pay 40% on their profits like everyone else. Changing CGT would improve inequality and provide revenue for the government.

attributes.action: Make Bioptic Lenses acceptable for achieving the eyesight standard for driving.
attributes.background: Bioptic Lenses are small optical scopes, that are mounted onto the spectacle frame, to help people with sight loss see extra detail in distant objects or texts. Often used to assist visually impaired individuals that still have a functional level of vision to complete everyday tasks such as driving.
attributes.additional_details: Bioptic driving began over 30 years ago in the US and is currently accepted in over 37 states as well as several European Countries, for both car and motorcycle licenses.  Current UK standards for driving have taken away the freedom and independence of thousands of individuals that would otherwise pose no additional risk to road users.  Consideration, in particular, should be given to those with stable non-progressive visual disorders, where Bioptics would allow them to meet the vision standard.

attributes.action: Create a single Bullying Law that applies to all Schools in England
attributes.background: Schools are letting pupils down by not taking Bullying seriously and ignoring their policies. There needs to be a Law on Bullying that all Schools have to abide by. There are Children taking their own lives and i feel this would stop if there was a law that made schools help.
attributes.additional_details: News Articles. My own experience with my Child. I have spoken to numerous other Parents about their experiences too

attributes.action: Allow rape victims to receive forensic examination and results before reporting
attributes.background: Potential rape victims often can't find out whether they have ingested a date rape drug unless they take legal action and report the crime. This involves undergoing a 3 hour forensic examination, making a video statement, and the arrest of the accused. They may also be forced to appear in court.
attributes.additional_details: Date rape drugs leave the system within 72 hours of being ingested, and forensic examinations should be made within this time frame too, so that the victim can eat, drink and shower normally. The decision to report is heavy, and should be given time. When forced to make a decision so quickly, victims are often pressured into reporting their crimes when it isn't in their interest to do so. Victims should have the right to receive the forensic examination and its results before reporting.

attributes.action: Stop the deportation of the Zeilsdorf Family from Laggan.
attributes.background: The family are waiting for imminent deportation as they have failed to meet the criteria of their Entrepreneur Visa by employing 2 people in their tiny shop and coffee bothy in Laggan. They do employ 1, they have 3 children, and take care of the local rural community by providing a valuable service.
attributes.additional_details: They are being forced to leave before they can sell. There's every chance that the business will not continue and the area will lose it's shop. Other similar services are tens of miles away. Their children are Scottish, they employ someone, and they make regular visits to local elderly and house bound people in the community as Jason was a Pastor. It is not the Highlands, Scotland or Scottish people who don't want and them; it is just the Home Office. We NEED them - sign  to keep the Zeilsdorfs.

attributes.action: Allow freedom of movement to continue within the tech sector
attributes.background: The UK has a skills shortage when it comes to tech, and in order for us to remain the digital capital of Europe. We must allow talent to come easily into the UK. A complicated visa process will mean that talent goes elsewhere and we suffer as a result of it.

attributes.action: Enforce harsher penalties for those who breach airports during protests
attributes.background: Recently, many "protesters" from environmental groups have been breaching airports and standing on runways. This is highly illegal, but they always leave with very small fines at worst.

attributes.action: Require universities to provide night-time safety to stop sexual harassment
attributes.background: Improve safety around the University at night for women and men when traveling and walking around the site.

attributes.action: Stop the Government ripoff on car road tax transfer return to old system
attributes.background: when a car is sold in the middle of the month the owner losses two weeks road tax refund and the new owner has to pay from the beginning of the month  paying for two weeks he/she has not had,so the GOV.is stealing four weeks road tax, return to the old system where the road tax can stay with the car

attributes.action: Stop Theresa May allowing schools to wholly discriminate based on religion
attributes.background: Theresa May wishes to relax the school admission rules to allow them to select every child from one religion. Creating environments where children would not come into contact with a children from a different background to themselves.
attributes.additional_details:
The complete segregation of children will encourage a more disparate society in the future, with less understanding of each other.

Schools should exist to educate - not to encourage tribalism. 

Furthermore; religious schools do not allow a free, independent arena for children to learn to question. When a child receives religion from a place of worship, home and school - there is no space to form an independent opinion. It's tantamount to brain washing.

attributes.action: Implement a detection system to stop parental abduction of children leaving U.K
attributes.background: The government needs to implement a no nonsense approach to stopping one parent abducting a child to another country at Airports and all points of travel especially holiday seasons. Systems as such already exist in Canada, US and even in the Middle East.
attributes.additional_details:
Government needs to make sure kids cannot leave from the U.K without the consent of both parents 
"Nobody asked if he had my permission to take her" 
Sarah Taylor Rise in parental child abductions 
Foreign Office figures that show that the number of British children abducted by a parent and taken overseas has increased in the past year. 
A mother's lengthy search for her kidnapped child-http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk

attributes.action: Introduce periodic retention elections for the judges of the UK Supreme Court.
attributes.background: Periodic retention elections would enable Supreme Court judges to be  removed from office by popular vote if their judgements were deemed to be improper or to subvert government and the will of the people.
attributes.additional_details: Such elections are already used by the Supreme Courts of many US states to make judges accountable to the people.  Thus there is already a successful working precedent for such elections.

attributes.action: British & European Citizenship for those who wish to remain a part of Europe.
attributes.background: Given that there is precedent for dual nationality in N.Ireland I feel it is only fair, and morally right, that as just under half of the country didn't want to leave the EU that those who wish to stay should have the option to keep European citizenship when Brexit negotiations begin.
attributes.additional_details:
I was born in N.Ireland and as I grew up I was told I was N.Irish, Irish, British and European. I had a choice on who I affiliated myself with and I had a choice to be a part of something smaller, or something bigger; I chose the latter.

It is therefore, with precedent and just under half the country having voted to remain, that the government should not ignore what is a large minority and give everyone the rights that others in these islands already have.

Choice on citizenship!

attributes.action: Invest in more Gender Clinics around the UK
attributes.background: There are currently two Gender Clinics in the UK - one in London and one in Leeds. The waiting list for both clinics can be up to 18 months, sometimes even longer, because of the increase in acceptance and openness about gender identity.
attributes.additional_details: I was referred to Tavistock in London in April/May 2016 and my referral got accepted around November 2016, I am still currently waiting for an appointment 9/10 months on from my referral date. From personal experience, the NHS are an incredible asset to the UK and without it we'd undeniably be in a much worse position. However, Gender Clinics are very far stretched and I struggle with the wait hugely which has major impacts on my mental health. I'm not the only one with this issue, fact.

attributes.action: Abolish Sunday trading for all High Street Retailers
attributes.background: We lost something valuable as a country when Sunday became a normal shopping day rather than a day for family, rest and relaxation. The freedom of some to shop on Sundays comes at the expense of those who have to work to serve them when they might want to spend time with their families

attributes.action: Schools to allow pupils with excellent attendance, holidays during term time.
attributes.background: Taking a summer or winter holiday during half term or end of term, is incredibly expensive when you have children.  Holiday companies monopolise on parents like me every year, to the point where we sometimes just cannot afford to go away. I want the Government to consider a fair way to address this.
attributes.additional_details: Children with excellent attendance records should be able to take up to two weeks holiday per year (subject to the school agreeing the timings) to spend quality time away with their family.  I have a family of 5 and for us to camp in France in August will cost around £3,500 just for travel (by ferry) and accommodation (mobile home).  Nothing lavish, but very expensive when you throw in spending money too.  If we did this in May or June, it works out at £1200!  This seems so unfair for Parents.

attributes.action: Pressure NICE to approve Nivolumab for lung cancer patients
attributes.background: Denied by Nice in England and Wales, this drug is freely available in Scotland. This drug could help cure patients suffering from Lung cancer, yet the government won't allow its use. Sign today lets start changing this disgrace immediately

attributes.action: Compulsory for UK schools to teach about sexual consent.
attributes.background: In the UK, it's not compulsory for schools to teach anything about sexual consent or healthy relationships, only about the biology of sex. Before teenagers are sexually active, consent education will give them the power to recognise when receiving or inflicting abuse/exploitation/rape.
attributes.additional_details: On average, the age of first intercourse experience is 15.6 years (14.9 for men and 15.9 for women). It seems, the majority of teenagers are sexually active before the legal age. It is for this reason, sexual consent must be taught before the age of 16. Not just our daughters should leave school able to navigate the sexual challenges and choices they’ll face in adulthood but more importantly boys. Schools must become educators and advocates of sex-positivity/healthy consent for both genders.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to deny estranged parents to be denied access to kids
attributes.background: It should be law that the estranged partner, be automatically allowed access to their children. If they truly pose a risk to them, the onus should be with the partner the children reside with to go to court prove why they feel it is not in the children's best interest to see the other parent.
attributes.additional_details: This mainly affects estranged Fathers, and now there is no legal aide for family matters, and the fact CSA take up to 40% of their wage for maintainence that they have to pay despite them being denied any kind of relationship with their children, a lot of Fathers can't afford to go to court. This is not equality!! If the children are young they can't express their needs, the law needs to ensure they do not suffer. We have enough childhood Depression. We need to put the children first.

attributes.action: Stop the Heathrow Airport expansion
attributes.background: The UK government decided to build another runway at Heathrow Airport. This topic has been up for debate for many months & out of the 2 largest airports (Heathrow & Gatwick), the UK Government felt that another runway should be added to Heathrow. Since the news broke out, social media has received
attributes.additional_details: thousands of people expressing their concern on the #HeathrowExpansion, stating that this should have gone to Gatwck . Heathrow itself, is already a mega sized airport & as a local resident, I can tell you how bad it can be with the noise & the releasing of jet fuel on the local resident houses & the other problem is that, they are promising jobs, but what about job loses! All it takes is another major attack, & people will not fly as much, which will lead to pressure on airlines & job losses.

attributes.action: Stop any UK aircraft from intercepting Russian aircraft in Syria.
attributes.background: To prevent any escalation between Russia and the United States, and Britain's involvement in a future large scale war in Syria leading to a global conflict.  We request that Her Majesty's Government order a stand down of all R.A.F planes from firing upon Russian planes.

attributes.action: To create an intermediate tier paper for maths GCSE (all exam boards)
attributes.background: Many students taking the higher tier maths GCSE paper, struggle with the contents, but find the foundation tier too easy. I am petitioning for an 'inbetween paper' that allows students of 'medium ability' to be able to get higher than a grade C at GCSE.

attributes.action: Investigate the UK's role in launching airstrikes during the Syrian ceasefire
attributes.background: US Secretary of State John Kerry referred to the recent truce in Syria as the "last chance" for peace (1). Despite this, the UK "unintentionally" killed 62 Syrian soldiers in an airstrike during the ceasefire (2). We the undersigned demand to know how the UK put global stability at risk in this way.
attributes.additional_details:
The United Kingdom elected to become directly involved in the devastating Syrian conflict when our parliament voted in 2015 to join a coalition of nations performing airstrikes in the region(3).
Now we have broken a truce that our allies helped to establish.

(1) - http://news.sky.com/story/syria-ceasefire-begins-amid-concerns-from-rebel-groups-10575628
(2) - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-37409236
(3) - https://www.parliament.uk/business/news/2015/december/mps-debate-motion-on-isil-in-syria/

attributes.action: Introduce medical intervention sooner for those suffering with Anorexia Nervosa
attributes.background: Medical intervention should begin sooner to prevent a patients rapid deterioration of health. Counselling as a first form of treatment is not at all useful on its own if the patient is suffering malnourishment. Their brain lacks ability to concentrate and withhold useful advice and information.
attributes.additional_details: Medical and counselling services should work hand in hand to ensure fast diagnosis and early intervention. Medical help to prevent extreme rapid deterioration of an individual health is vital. Much to the individuals refusal and disapproval this should be pressed or encouraged to help the recovery process begin as soon as possible. Putting off recovery will only prolong the suffering and tormenting thoughts, allowing them to become the only way in life like a 'voice' that must be abided by.

attributes.action: Make south west water improve the water treatment plant in Looe Cornwall
attributes.background: Looe in south east Cornwall has been taken over by the stench of the sewage works, especially west Looe. The odours are repugnant and is putting off holidaymakers. We also lose tourist because sewage is allowed to overflow in heavy rains affecting both the estuary and the water quality on the beach.

attributes.action: Make all UK schools enforce their school bullying policies legally
attributes.background: Schools legally have to have bullying policies but they do not legally have to enforce their policies as they currently only have discretionary meaning. They legally don't have any powers to enforce their policies and this has to be changed for safety well-being of all children's no 1 priority.
attributes.additional_details: Government statistics released say 1.5 million pupils are bullied verbally or physically or both in the last 12 months which was on national news TV etc. Therefore it's children's and pupils' lives that are being ruined and destroyed and society in general and schools are failing to act cause of current policies and legislations and have no powers.
attributes.creator_name: Stephen McCulloch On Behalf Of Anti Bullying Ambassadors

attributes.action: Amend the Equality Act to require Hotels to have Part M compliant guest room.
attributes.background: Disabled persons find it almost impossible to find suitable accommodation in hotels.  The Public Sector is required to make reasonable adjustments to physical features in line with Part M design standards whereas the Private Sector simply has a non-specific a duty to make reasonable adjustments.
attributes.additional_details: In a 2015 debate in the House of Lords it was stated that thousands of hotels around the country were not meeting the needs of disabled persons. It is common practice to provide grab rails and signage but circulation space, access to walk-in showers and raised beds are sadly overlooked.  This year I was forced by these circumstances to miss a significant part of my son's wedding because a hotel had, in their opinion, undertaken the reasonable adjustments to make their facility fully accessible.

attributes.action: Return Common Sense to Court, Abolish the PC interfering 'Sentencing Council'
attributes.background: English courts no longer have TEETH! Due to its overly lenient & PC guidelines & interference, The 'Sentencing Council' has seriously undermined public confidence in our Courts.Tying the hands of judges by having them put Political Correctness before common sense & appropriate punishment
attributes.additional_details:
Forcing courts to follow these guidelines is preventing judges from handing down the prescribed penalties, fines & or custodial sentences (described in various criminal legislations & acts) as they were originally intended by the acts of Parliament.

The Council exists to ensure consistency of sentencing, clarification of court processes and sentencing for the victims and the public, and to increase public confidence in the criminal justice system. It has failed completely to do this.

attributes.action: Ban all Spread Betting, CFD, and Binary Option provider's from the UK market
attributes.background: Spread Betting, CFD, and Binary Option provider's are manipulating the UK stock market to such an extent, that it creates very high levels of volatility within our top 250 UK listed companies.
attributes.additional_details: The resulting fallout from these providers has turned what was once an optional investment strategy for private investors, into a cesspool of manipulated criminality that now controls our stock market through what are known as 'STOP-OUT' clauses.

attributes.action: Stop the need for people with permanent disabilities to renew their Blue Badges
attributes.background: Currently everyone in need of a blue badge has to renew it every 3 years. In some cases where the situation is temporary this is fine. For most though their situations are not going to change. It is unnecessary for us to renew.

attributes.action: Issue Identity card for all legal residents of the UK that must be carried.
attributes.background: Our forces and emergency services have to carry ID, so why can't we all! The card can simply be linked to your NI number. Police, Immigration, the NHS and other public services can identify someone's eligibility for residency or any public service. It will only hinder those with something to hide.
attributes.additional_details:
Why do we need this: Health Tourism of the NHS, fraud in our benefits system, illegal immigration and national security

Assist an already stretched Police Force, assist a stretched NHS and public services.

Immigration services can Identify illegal imigrants quickly and easily.

Use the identity card throughout multiple public services to assist with repetitive administrative functions.

It makes sense!!

attributes.action: Change Use Class C3 wording to prevent LTD Company abuse of “Lawful Development”
attributes.background: Planning regs. Use Class C3 wording should be changed to “up to six people living together as a single household and receiving care from non-residential carers” to stop multimillion £ Ltd Companies using private residential houses as care homes without requiring planning permission for change of use
attributes.additional_details:
Councils are consistently concluding that a change of use DOES occur.  

Some are rejecting applications and some are issuing certificates on the basis that the change does not constitute a MATERIAL change in use in PLANNING TERMS.

Application DA/2015/0762 in Daventry District Council and SL/2016/0608 South Lakeland District Council were both submitted by the same company with a multi-million £ turnover citing the same evidence.  One rejected, the other permitted. 

Two of many inconsistencies.

attributes.action: Make the Asylum seeker dispersal scheme mandatory to all councils in the U.K.
attributes.background:
The process in which Asylum seekers are granted housing in the U.K. is dependant on councils that volunteer to be part of the scheme. 
Currently, there is no mandatory requirement for all councils to participate meaning that councils are able to, and do abstain from the effort.
attributes.additional_details:
The humanitarian crisis we are facing should not be left only to those councils most willing, as it creates an unnecessarily large strain on some councils that should be shared. 

At least 38 councils have not signed up to the scheme which includes the rehoming of refugee children who entered the UK alone. 

The current voluntary system is unfair, and means that schools, healthcare resources and other public services in participating councils are needlessly overstretched.

attributes.action: Condemn the disgraceful and dangerous actions of Donald Trump
attributes.background:
Cancelling affordable healthcare for people with long term conditions, possibly at risk of their lives.
Denying entry to the US to people with a legal right to be there. 
Removing federal funding from any organisation that offers abortion advice - even for victims of rape.

And much more
attributes.additional_details:
Also

Condoning sexual misconduct.
Presenting ‘alternative facts’ or ‘lies’ as the rest of us call them.
Removing federal funding from any organisation that offers abortion advice - even for victims of rape.
Ordering the removal of climate change information from government web sites.

And probably more, news is breaking faster than I can type.

http://www.newstatesman.com/world/2017/01/here-are-23-terrifying-things-president-trump-has-done-last-seven-days

attributes.action: Lower Business rates in England
attributes.background: Small businesses are struggling to survive crippling business rates. Rates must be reassessed and lowered so small businesses continue to provide income and work for people. Internet sales & Brexit have put small businesses seriously at risk, Theresa May wants business to increase in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: Amount of shops closing and small businesses that just cannot pay present level of business rates.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory that schools, colleges & staff working with children know CPR
attributes.background:
After reading so many stories this week, both positive and negative, people are still dying because of the lack of basic first aid training

Hopefully this will go to the government and ask why schools, colleges and people that work with children aren't being taught CPR & the importance of it.
attributes.additional_details:
Making this compulsory, will not only save someone's life if the need arises, but will make people aware of the need for training. 

Being an aspiring Paramedic, I know the importance of bystander CPR, as it increases the percentage of someone being saved and regaining life.

attributes.action: Right to buy from housing association with full discount make housing accessible
attributes.background:
We have Right to buy which provides you discount if you have lived in council property for over 3 years. 

We can get up to 50% discount of property 

Like if you lived in council property for 15 years you are eligible for 45% Discount 

£150000 * 45 / 100 = 67,500 you pay only £82,500
attributes.additional_details:
https://righttobuy.gov.uk/right-to-buy-calculator/

https://www.gov.uk/right-to-acquire-buying-housing-association-home/overview

We would like the government to provide the same discount for Right to Acquire as Right to Buy. This will help lot of people to get on property ladder and easily accessible especially for younger generation as they are eligible if they have lived in the household. With rise in rent and housing prices this would be best option for lower to middle class to become owners

attributes.action: Support the setup of educational foster care homes - like free schools.
attributes.background:
I am a Primary School Teacher and a Foster (Kinship) Carer. For many years I have seen and taught children who are in care - Looked After Child (LAC). These children need us! 
An educational foster home could offer stability, consistency, care and love and deliver fantastic outcomes for children.
attributes.additional_details:
Nearly 64,000 children live with almost 55,000 foster families across the UK each day. This is nearly 80% of the 81,000 children in care away from home on any one day in the UK. 

The Government's DfE paper states: “Where birth parents cannot meet a child’s basic needs it is one of the state’s most important responsibilities to step in and ensure that children can have a childhood which keeps them safe and enables them to flourish." 

With a UK shortage of foster carers this petition can help!

attributes.action: Make MP's send yearly report to their constituents.
attributes.background: In a time of information and misinformation I propose that MP's send a report to each of their constituents outlying which bills they have voted for, against or abstained. Their attendance in office and parliament and their expenses.
attributes.additional_details: As public servants and representatives of the people, MP's should send information of what they have voted for (on our behalf), so we can decide if we choose to keep them in office. I am aware that this information is in the public domain, but is not readily available to us all. In a society where we celebrate  democracy, the MP's should be happy for us to see what they are doing and allow us to celebrate their achievements by voting them in next time.
